Handles edge cases like invalid grades.\n */\npublic class ReportCard {\n    private Map<String, Double> grades;\n    \n    /**\n     * Default constructor - initializes an empty grade map\n     */\n    public ReportCard() {\n        this.grades = new HashMap<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor with initial grades\n     * \n     * @param grades Initial map of subject-grade pairs\n     */\n    public ReportCard(Map<String, Double> grades) {\n        this.grades = new HashMap<>(grades);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Add or update a grade for a subject\n     * Validates the grade is within valid range (0-100)\n     * \n     * @param subject The subject name\n     * @param grade The grade value (0-100)\n     * @return true if grade was successfully added/updated, false if grade is invalid\n     */\n    public boolean addOrUpdateGrade(String subject, double grade) {\n        if (!isValidGrade(grade)) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        grades.put(subject, grade);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Remove a grade for a specific subject\n     * \n     * @param subject The subject name to remove\n     * @return true if grade was removed, false if subject didn\'t exist\n     */\n    public boolean removeGrade(String subject) {\n        return grades.remove(subject) != null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get grade for a specific subject\n     * \n     * @param subject The subject name\n     * @return The grade value, or null if subject doesn\'t exist\n     */\n    public Double getGrade(String subject) {\n        return grades.get(subject);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get all grades as an unmodifiable map\n     * \n     * @return Map of all subject-grade pairs\n     */\n    public Map<String, Double> getAllGrades() {\n        return new HashMap<>(grades);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Calculate the average grade across all subjects\n     * Handles edge case when there are no grades\n     * \n     * @return The average grade, or 0.0 if no grades exist\n     */\n    public double calculateAverage() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0.0;\n        }\n        \n        double sum = 0.0;\n        for (double grade : grades.values()) {\n            sum += grade;\n        }\n        return sum / grades.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the highest grade among all subjects\n     * \n     * @return The highest grade, or 0.0 if no grades exist\n     */\n    public double getHighestGrade() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0.0;\n        }\n        \n        double highest = Double.MIN_VALUE;\n        for (double grade : grades.values()) {\n            if (grade > highest) {\n                highest = grade;\n            }\n        }\n        return highest;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the lowest grade among all subjects\n     * \n     * @return The lowest grade, or 0.0 if no grades exist\n     */\n    public double getLowestGrade() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0.0;\n        }\n        \n        double lowest = Double.MAX_VALUE;\n        for (double grade : grades.values()) {\n            if (grade < lowest) {\n                lowest = grade;\n            }\n        }\n        return lowest;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if a grade value is valid (between 0 and 100 inclusive)\n     * \n     * @param grade The grade to validate\n     * @return true if grade is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean isValidGrade(double grade) {\n        return grade >= 0.0 && grade <= 100.0;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if the report card has any grades\n     * \n     * @return true if there are grades, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasGrades() {\n        return !grades.isEmpty();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the number of subjects with grades\n     * \n     * @return Count of subjects\n     */\n    public int getSubjectCount() {\n        return grades.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clear all grades from the report card\n     */\n    public void clearAllGrades() {\n        grades.clear();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * String representation of the ReportCard\n     * Shows all subjects and grades, plus average\n     * \n     * @return Formatted string with report card details\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return "Report Card: No grades available";\n        }\n        \n        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();\n        sb.append("Report Card:\\n");\n        for (Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : grades.entrySet()) {\n            sb.append(String.format("  %s: %.2f\\n", entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()));\n        }\n        sb.append(String.format("Average Grade: %.2f", calculateAverage()));\n        return sb.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if two report cards are equal\n     * Two report cards are equal if they have the same grades\n     * \n     * @param obj Object to compare with\n     * @return true if report cards have same grades, false otherwise\n     */\n    @Override\n    public boolean  private List<Student> students;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for Administrator class\n     * \n     * @param username Administrator username\n     * @param password Administrator password\n     */\n    public Administrator(String username, String password) {\n        this.username = username;\n        this.password = password;\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        this.students = new ArrayList<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Attempt to log in with provided credentials\n     * \n     * @param inputUsername Username to check\n     * @param inputPassword Password to check\n     * @return true if login successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean login(String inputUsername, String inputPassword) {\n        if (username.equals(inputUsername) && password.equals(inputPassword)) {\n            isLoggedIn = true;\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Log out the administrator\n     */\n    public void logout() {\n        isLoggedIn = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if administrator is currently logged in\n     * \n     * @return true if logged in, false otherwise\n     */\n false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if student already exists\n        for (Student s : students) {\n            if (s.getStudentId().equals(student.getStudentId())) {\n                return false; // Student ID already exists\n            }\n        }\n        \n        students.add(student);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Find a student by their ID\n     * (student.getStudentId().equals(studentId)) {\n                return student;\n            }\n        }\n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Edit a student\'s report card by updating subject names and new grades\n     * @return true if edit successful, false if student not found, not logged in, or invalid grades\n     */\n    public boolean editStudentReportCard(String studentId, java.util.Map<String, Double> subjectGrades) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        Student student = findStudentById(studentId);\n        if (student == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        ReportCard reportCard = student.getReportCard();\n        boolean allGradesValid = true;\n        \n        // Validate all grades before making any changes\n        for (java.util.Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : subjectGrades.entrySet()) {\n            if (!ReportCard.isValidGrade(entry.getValue())) {\n                allGradesValid = false;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!allGradesValid) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Update grades\n        for (java.util.Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : subjectGrades.entrySet()) {\n            reportCard.addOrUpdateGrade(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get all students in the system\n     * Only allowed if administrator is logged in\n     * \n     * @return List of all students, or empty list if not logged in\n     */\n    public List<Student> getAllStudents() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        return new ArrayList<>(students);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Remove a student from the system\n     * Only allowed if administrator is logged in\n     * \n     * @param studentId ID of the student to remove\n     * @return true if student removed successfully, false if not found or not logged in\n     */\n    public boolean removeStudent(String studentId) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        Student studentToRemove = null;\n        for (Student student : students) {\n            if (student.getStudentId().equals(studentId)) {\n                studentToRemove = student;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (studentToRemove != null) {\n            students.remove(studentToRemove);\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the username of the administrator\n     * \n     * @return Administrator username\n     */\n    public String getUsername() {\n        return username;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the number of students in the system\n     * \n     * @return Count of students\n     */\n    public int getStudentCount() {\n        return students.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clear all students from the system\n     * Only allowed if administrator is logged in\n     * \n     * @return true if cleared successfully, false if not logged in\n     */\n    public boolean clearAllStudents() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        students.clear();\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * String representation of the Administrator\n     * Shows System displays form with fields to modify (including subject grades)\n * 2. User enters new data and clicks confirmation\n * 3. System displays confirmation message and shows the form with list of students\n */\npublic class EditOfOnePage {\n    private Administrator administrator;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for EditOfOnePage\n     * \n     * @param administrator The administrator who will perform the edit operation\n     */\n    public EditOfOnePage(Administrator administrator) {\n        this.administrator = administrator;\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the EditOfOnePage use case\n     * This method orchestrates the complete workflow for editing a student\'s report card\n     * \n     * @return true if the use case completed successfully, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeEditUseCase() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Starting EditOfOnePage Use Case ===");\n        \n        // Precondition check: Administrator must be logged in\n        if (!administrator.isLoggedIn()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Administrator must be logged in to perform this operation.");\n            System.out.println("Precondition failed: User is not logged in as administrator.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Precondition check: Administrator must have carried out \'DisplayedUnapagella\'\n        // and clicked the edit button (simulated by having students in the system)\n        if (administrator.getStudentCount() == 0) {\n            System.out.println("Error: No students available to edit.");\n            System.out.println("Precondition failed: Must have carried out \'DisplayedUnapagella\' first.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Display the form with list of students (simulating DisplayedUnapagella)\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Displaying List of Students ---");\n        displayStudentsList();\n        \n        // Step 2: Get student ID to edit\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Select Student to Edit ---");\n        String studentId = promptForStudentId();\n        if (studentId == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Display current report card for the selected student\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 3: Current Report Card ---");\n        Student student = administrator.findStudentById(studentId);\n        if (student == null) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Student not found with ID: " + studentId);\n            return false;\n        }\n        displayStudentReportCard(student);\n        \n        // Step 4: Display form with fields to modify\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Edit Form ---");\n        System.out.println("Enter from user\n        Map<String, Double> newGrades = collectNewGrades(student.getReportCard());\n        \n        // Step 6: Confirm and apply changes\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 6: Confirmation ---");\n        if (confirmChanges(student, newGrades)) {\n            // Apply the changes\n            boolean success = administrator.editStudentReportCard(studentId, newGrades);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                // Step 7: Display confirmation message\n                System.out.println("\\n✓✓✓ CONFIRMATION MESSAGE ✓✓✓");\n                System.out.println("The report card for student " + student.getName() + \n                                 " (ID: " + studentId + ") has been successfully updated!");\n                \n                // Postcondition: Report has been modified\n                System.out.println("\\n✓ Postcondition satisfied: Report for student has been modified.");\n                \n true;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to update report card. Please check if grades are valid (0-100).");\n                return false;\n            }\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Edit operation cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the list of all students in the system\n     * This simulates the \'DisplayedUnapagella\' functionality\n     */\n    private void displayStudentsList() {\n        System.out.println("List of Students:");\n        System.out.println("=================");\n        \n        java.util.List<Student> students = administrator.getAllStudents();\n        if (students.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No students found in the system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        for (int i = 0; i < students.size(); i++) {\n            Student student = students.get(i);\n            System.out.printf("%d. ID: %-10s Name: %-20s\\n", \n                            i + 1, student.getStudentId(), student.getName());\n        }\n        System.out.println("=================");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Prompt the user to enter a student ID for editing\n     * \n     * @return The student ID entered by user, or null if cancelled\n     */\n    private String promptForStudentId() {\n        System.out.print("Enter the Student ID to edit (or \'cancel\' to abort): ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("cancel")) {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled.");\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate student exists\n        Student student = administrator.findStudentById(input);\n        if (student == null) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Student with ID \'" + input + "\' not found.");\n            return promptForStudentId(); // Recursive retry\n        }\n        \n        return input;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the current report card for a student\n     * \n     * @param student The student whose report card to display\n     */\n    private void displayStudentReportCard(Student student) {\n        System.out.println("Student: " + student.getName() + " (ID: " + student.getStudentId() + ")");\n        System.out.println(student.getReportCard().toString());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Collect new grades from the user\n     * \n     * @param currentReportCard The current report card to show existing grades\n     * @return Map of subject names to new grade values\n     */\n    private Map<String, Double> collectNewGrades(ReportCard currentReportCard) {\n        Map<String, Double> newGrades = new HashMap<>();\n        Map<String, Double> currentGrades = currentReportCard.getAllGrades();\n        \n        if (currentGrades.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No existing grades found. You can add new subjects.");\n            System.out.println("Format: <subject_name> <grade> (grade must be 0-100)");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Current grades:");\n            for (Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : currentGrades.entrySet()) {\n                System.out.printf("  %s: %.2f\\n", entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());\n            }\n            System.out.println("Enter subject name and new grade, or just subject name to remove.");\n        }\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("\\nEnter subject and grade (or \'done\' to finish): ");\n            String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("done")) {\n                break;\n            }\n            \n            if (input.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("Please enter a subject name and grade.");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            // Parse input\n            String[] parts = input.split("\\\\s+", 2);\n            String subject = parts[0].trim();\n            \n            if (parts.length == 1) {\n                // User wants to remove this subject\n                System.out.println("Subject \'" + subject + "\' will be removed.");\n                newGrades.put(subject, null); // Using null to indicate removal\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            try {\n                double grade = Double.parseDouble(parts[1].trim());\n                \n                // Validate grade range\n                if (!ReportCard.isValidGrade(grade)) {\n                    System.out.println("Error: Grade must be between 0 and 100. Please try again.");\n                    continue;\n                }\n                \n                newGrades.put(subject, grade);\n                System.out.println("Added: " + subject + " = " + grade);\n                \n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid grade format. Please enter a number.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return newGrades;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the proposed changes and ask for confirmation\n     * \n     * @param student The student being edited\n     * @param newGrades The new grades to apply\n     * @return true if user confirms, false if user cancels\n     */\n    private boolean confirmChanges(Student student, Map<String, Double> newGrades) {\n        if (newGrades.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No changes to apply.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nProposed changes for student: " + student.getName());\n        System.out.println("==========================================");\n        \n        Map<String, Double> currentGrades = student.getReportCard().getAllGrades();\n        \n        for (Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : newGrades.entrySet()) {\n            String subject = entry.getKey();\n            Double newGrade = entry.getValue();\n            Double currentGrade = currentGrades.get(subject);\n            \n            if (newGrade == null) {\n                System.out.printf("  REMOVE: %s (current: %.2f)\\n", subject, \n                                currentGrade != null ? currentGrade : 0.0);\n            } else if (currentGrade == null) {\n                System.out.printf("  ADD: %s = %.2f (new)\\n", subject, newGrade);\n            } else {\n                System.out.printf("  UPDATE: %s: %.2f → %.2f\\n", \n                                subject, currentGrade, newGrade);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("==========================================");\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("Confirm changes? (yes/no): ");\n            String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            if (response.equals("yes") || response.equals("y")) {\n                return true;\n            } else if (response.equals("no") || response.equals("n")) {\n                return false;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Please enter \'yes\' or \'no\'.");\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Close the scanner resource\n     * Should be called when done with the EditOfOnePage instance\n     */\n    public void close() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the administrator associated with this EditOfOnePage instance\n     * \n     * @return The administrator object\n     */\n    public Administrator getAdministrator() {\n        return administrator;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * String representation of EditOfOnePage\n     * \n     * @return String describing the EditOfOnePage instance\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return "EditOfOnePage [Administrator: " + administrator.getUsername() + \n               ", Logged in: " + administrator.isLoggedIn() + "]";\n    }\n}\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished. The new_content must be a complete block of code. Example 1: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to replace line 2 and line 3 edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"new content\\", ) This will replace the second line 2 and line 3 with \\"new content\\". The resulting file will be: ``` 001|contain f 002|new content 003|contain i ``` Example 2: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to remove the line 2 and line 3. edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"\\", ) This will remove line 2 and line 3. an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Handles edge cases like invalid grades.\n */\npublic class ReportCard {\n    private Map<String, Double> grades;\n    \n    /**\n     * Default constructor - initializes an empty grade map\n     */\n    public ReportCard() {\n        this.grades = new HashMap<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor with initial grades\n     * \n     * @param grades Initial map of subject-grade pairs\n     */\n    public ReportCard(Map<String, Double> grades) {\n        this.grades = new HashMap<>(grades);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Add or update a grade for a subject\n     * Validates the grade is within valid range (0-100)\n     * \n     * @param subject The subject name\n     * @param grade The grade value (0-100)\n     * @return true if grade was successfully added/updated, false if grade is invalid\n     */\n    public boolean addOrUpdateGrade(String subject, double grade) {\n        if (!isValidGrade(grade)) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        grades.put(subject, grade);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Remove a grade for a specific subject\n     * \n     * @param subject The subject name to remove\n     * @return true if grade was removed, false if subject didn\'t exist\n     */\n    public boolean removeGrade(String subject) {\n        return grades.remove(subject) != null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get grade for a specific subject\n     * \n     * @param subject The subject name\n     * @return The grade value, or null if subject doesn\'t exist\n     */\n    public Double getGrade(String subject) {\n        return grades.get(subject);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get all grades as an unmodifiable map\n     * \n     * @return Map of all subject-grade pairs\n     */\n    public Map<String, Double> getAllGrades() {\n        return new HashMap<>(grades);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Calculate the average grade across all subjects\n     * Handles edge case when there are no grades\n     * \n     * @return The average grade, or 0.0 if no grades exist\n     */\n    public double calculateAverage() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0.0;\n        }\n        \n        double sum = 0.0;\n        for (double grade : grades.values()) {\n            sum += grade;\n        }\n        return sum / grades.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the highest grade among all subjects\n     * \n     * @return The highest grade, or 0.0 if no grades exist\n     */\n    public double getHighestGrade() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0.0;\n        }\n        \n        double highest = Double.MIN_VALUE;\n        for (double grade : grades.values()) {\n            if (grade > highest) {\n                highest = grade;\n            }\n        }\n        return highest;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the lowest grade among all subjects\n     * \n     * @return The lowest grade, or 0.0 if no grades exist\n     */\n    public double getLowestGrade() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0.0;\n        }\n        \n        double lowest = Double.MAX_VALUE;\n        for (double grade : grades.values()) {\n            if (grade < lowest) {\n                lowest = grade;\n            }\n        }\n        return lowest;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if a grade value is valid (between 0 and 100 inclusive)\n     * \n     * @param grade The grade to validate\n     * @return true if grade is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean isValidGrade(double grade) {\n        return grade >= 0.0 && grade <= 100.0;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if the report card has any grades\n     * \n     * @return true if there are grades, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasGrades() {\n        return !grades.isEmpty();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the number of subjects with grades\n     * \n     * @return Count of subjects\n     */\n    public int getSubjectCount() {\n        return grades.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clear all grades from the report card\n     */\n    public void clearAllGrades() {\n        grades.clear();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * String representation of the ReportCard\n     * Shows all subjects and grades, plus average\n     * \n     * @return Formatted string with report card details\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return "Report Card: No grades available";\n        }\n        \n        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();\n        sb.append("Report Card:\\n");\n        for (Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : grades.entrySet()) {\n            sb.append(String.format("  %s: %.2f\\n", entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()));\n        }\n        sb.append(String.format("Average Grade: %.2f", calculateAverage()));\n        return sb.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if two report cards are equal\n     * Two report cards are equal */\n    public Administrator(String username, String password) {\n        this.username = username;\n        this.password = password;\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        this.students = new ArrayList<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Attempt to log in with provided credentials\n     * \n     * @param inputUsername Username to check\n     * @param inputPassword Password to check\n     * password.equals(inputPassword)) {\n            isLoggedIn = true;\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Log out the administrator\n     */\n (student.getStudentId().equals(studentId)) {\n                return student;\n            }\n        }\n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Edit a student\'s report card by updating == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        ReportCard reportCard = student.getReportCard();\n        boolean allGradesValid = true;\n        \n        // Validate all grades before making any changes\n        for (java.util.Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : subjectGrades.entrySet()) {\n            if (!ReportCard.isValidGrade(entry.getValue())) {\n                allGradesValid = false;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!allGradesValid) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Update grades\n        for (java.util.Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : subjectGrades.entrySet()) {\n            reportCard.addOrUpdateGrade(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get all students in the system\n     * Only allowed if administrator is logged in\n     * \n     * @return List of all students, or empty list if not logged in\n     */\n    public List<Student> getAllStudents() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        return new ArrayList<>(students);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Remove a student from the system\n     * Only allowed if administrator is logged in\n     * \n     * @param studentId ID of the student to remove\n     * @return true if student removed successfully, false if not found or not logged in\n     */\n    public boolean removeStudent(String studentId) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        Student studentToRemove = null;\n        for (Student student : students) {\n            if (student.getStudentId().equals(studentId)) {\n                studentToRemove = student;\n                break;\n            }\n of students in the system\n     * \n     * @return Count of students\n     */\n    public int getStudentCount() {\n        return students.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clear all students from System displays form with fields to modify (including subject grades)\n * 2. User enters new data and clicks confirmation\n * 3. System displays confirmation message and shows the form with list of students\n */\npublic class EditOfOnePage {\n    private Administrator administrator;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for EditOfOnePage\n     * \n     * @param administrator The administrator who will perform the edit operation\n     */\n    public EditOfOnePage(Administrator administrator) {\n        this.administrator = administrator;\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the EditOfOnePage use case\n     * This method orchestrates the complete workflow for editing a student\'s report card\n     * \n     * @return true if the use case completed successfully, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeEditUseCase() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Starting EditOfOnePage Use Case ===");\n        \n        // Precondition check: Administrator must be logged in\n        if (!administrator.isLoggedIn()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Administrator must be logged in to perform this operation.");\n            System.out.println("Precondition failed: User is not edit button (simulated by having students in the system)\n        if (administrator.getStudentCount() == 0) {\n            System.out.println("Error: No students available to edit.");\n            System.out.println("Precondition failed: Must have carried out \'DisplayedUnapagella\' first.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Display the form with list of edit\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Select Student to Edit ---");\n        String studentId = promptForStudentId();\n        if (studentId == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Display current report card for the selected student\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 3: Current Report Card ---");\n        Student student = administrator.findStudentById(studentId);\n        if (student == null) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Student not found with ID: " + studentId);\n            return false;\n        }\n        displayStudentReportCard(student);\n        \n        // Step 4: Display form with fields to modify\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Edit Form ---");\n        System.out.println("Enter from user\n        Map<String, Double> newGrades = collectNewGrades(student.getReportCard());\n        \n        // Step 6: Confirm and apply changes\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 6: Confirmation ---");\n        if (confirmChanges(student, newGrades)) {\n            // Apply the changes\n            boolean success = administrator.editStudentReportCard(studentId, newGrades);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                // Step 7: Display confirmation message\n                System.out.println("\\n✓✓✓ CONFIRMATION MESSAGE ✓✓✓");\n                System.out.println("The report card for student " + student.getName() + \n                                 " (ID: " + studentId + ") has been successfully updated!");\n                \n                // Postcondition: Report has been modified\n                System.out.println("\\n✓ Postcondition satisfied: Report for student has been modified.");\n                \n true;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to update report card. Please check if grades are valid (0-100).");\n                return false;\n            }\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Edit operation cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the list of all students in the system\n     * This simulates the \'DisplayedUnapagella\' functionality\n     */\n    private void displayStudentsList() {\n        System.out.println("List of Students:");\n        System.out.println("=================");\n        \n        java.util.List<Student> students = administrator.getAllStudents();\n        if (students.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No students found in the system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        for (int i = 0; i < students.size(); i++) {\n            Student student = students.get(i);\n            System.out.printf("%d. ID: %-10s Name: %-20s\\n", \n                            i + 1, student.getStudentId(), student.getName());\n        }\n        System.out.println("=================");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Prompt the user to enter a student ID for editing\n     * \n     * @return The student ID entered by user, or null if cancelled\n     */\n    private String promptForStudentId() {\n        System.out.print("Enter the Student ID to edit (or \'cancel\' to abort): ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("cancel")) {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled.");\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate student exists\n        Student student = administrator.findStudentById(input);\n        if (student == null) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Student with ID \'" + input + "\' not found.");\n            return promptForStudentId(); // Recursive retry\n        }\n        \n        return input;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the current report card for a student\n     * \n     * @param student The student whose report card to display\n     */\n    private void displayStudentReportCard(Student student) {\n        System.out.println("Student: " + student.getName() + " (ID: " + student.getStudentId() + ")");\n        System.out.println(student.getReportCard().toString());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Collect new grades from the user\n     * \n     * @param currentReportCard The current report card to show existing grades\n     * @return Map of subject names to new grade values\n     */\n    private Map<String, Double> collectNewGrades(ReportCard currentReportCard) {\n        Map<String, Double> newGrades = new HashMap<>();\n        Map<String, Double> currentGrades = currentReportCard.getAllGrades();\n        \n        if (currentGrades.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No existing grades found. You can add new subjects.");\n            System.out.println("Format: <subject_name> <grade> (grade must be 0-100)");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Current grades:");\n            for (Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : currentGrades.entrySet()) {\n                System.out.printf("  %s: %.2f\\n", entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());\n            }\n            System.out.println("Enter subject name and new grade, or just subject name to remove.");\n        }\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("\\nEnter subject and grade (or \'done\' to finish): ");\n            String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("done")) {\n                break;\n            }\n            \n            if (input.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("Please enter a subject name and grade.");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            // Parse input\n            String[] parts = input.split("\\\\s+", 2);\n            String subject = parts[0].trim();\n            \n            if (parts.length == 1) {\n                // User wants to remove this subject\n                System.out.println("Subject \'" + subject + "\' will be removed.");\n                newGrades.put(subject, null); // Using null to indicate removal\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            try {\n                double grade = Double.parseDouble(parts[1].trim());\n                \n                // Validate grade range\n                if (!ReportCard.isValidGrade(grade)) {\n                    System.out.println("Error: Grade must be between 0 and 100. Please try again.");\n                    continue;\n                }\n                \n                newGrades.put(subject, grade);\n                System.out.println("Added: " + subject + " = " + grade);\n                \n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid grade format. Please enter a number.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return newGrades;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the proposed changes and ask for confirmation\n     * \n     * @param student The student being edited\n     * @param newGrades The new grades to apply\n     * @return true if user confirms, false if user cancels\n     */\n    private boolean confirmChanges(Student student, Map<String, Double> newGrades) {\n        if (newGrades.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No changes to apply.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nProposed changes for student: " + student.getName());\n        System.out.println("==========================================");\n        \n        Map<String, Double> currentGrades = student.getReportCard().getAllGrades();\n        \n        for (Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : newGrades.entrySet()) {\n            String subject = entry.getKey();\n            Double newGrade = entry.getValue();\n            Double currentGrade = currentGrades.get(subject);\n            \n            if (newGrade == null) {\n                System.out.printf("  REMOVE: %s (current: %.2f)\\n", subject, \n                                currentGrade != null ? currentGrade : 0.0);\n            } else if (currentGrade == null) {\n                System.out.printf("  ADD: %s = %.2f (new)\\n", subject, newGrade);\n            } else {\n                System.out.printf("  UPDATE: %s: %.2f → %.2f\\n", \n                                subject, currentGrade, newGrade);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("==========================================");\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("Confirm changes? (yes/no): ");\n            String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            if (response.equals("yes") || response.equals("y")) {\n                return true;\n            } else if (response.equals("no") || response.equals("n")) {\n                return false;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Please enter \'yes\' or \'no\'.");\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Close the scanner resource\n     * Should be called when done with the EditOfOnePage instance\n     */\n    public void close() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the administrator associated with this EditOfOnePage instance\n     * \n     * @return The administrator object\n     */\n    public Administrator getAdministrator() {\n        return administrator;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * String representation of EditOfOnePage\n     * \n     * @return String describing the EditOfOnePage instance\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return "EditOfOnePage [Administrator: " + administrator.getUsername() + \n               ", Logged in: " + administrator.isLoggedIn() + "]";\n    }\n}\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished. Handles edge cases like invalid grades.\n */\npublic class ReportCard {\n    private Map<String, Double> grades;\n    \n    /**\n     * Default constructor - initializes an empty grade map\n     */\n    public ReportCard() {\n        this.grades = new HashMap<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor with initial grades\n     * \n     * @param grades Initial map of subject-grade pairs\n     */\n    public ReportCard(Map<String, Double> grades) {\n        this.grades = new HashMap<>(grades);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Add or update a grade for a subject\n     * Validates the grade is within valid range (0-100)\n     * \n     * @param subject The subject name\n     * @param grade The grade value (0-100)\n     * @return true if grade was successfully added/updated, false if grade is invalid\n     */\n    public boolean addOrUpdateGrade(String subject, double grade) {\n        if (!isValidGrade(grade)) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        grades.put(subject, grade);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Remove a grade for a specific subject\n     * \n     * @param subject The subject name to remove\n     * @return true if grade was removed, false if subject didn\'t exist\n     */\n    public boolean removeGrade(String subject) {\n        return grades.remove(subject) != null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get grade for a specific subject\n     * \n     * @param subject The subject name\n     * @return The grade value, or null if subject doesn\'t exist\n     */\n    public Double getGrade(String subject) {\n        return grades.get(subject);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get all grades as an unmodifiable map\n     * \n     * @return Map of all subject-grade pairs\n     */\n    public Map<String, Double> getAllGrades() {\n        return new HashMap<>(grades);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Calculate the average grade across all subjects\n     * Handles edge case when there are no grades\n     * \n     * @return The average grade, or 0.0 if no grades exist\n     */\n    public double calculateAverage() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0.0;\n        }\n        \n        double sum = 0.0;\n        for (double grade : grades.values()) {\n            sum += grade;\n        }\n        return sum / grades.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the highest grade among all subjects\n     * \n     * @return The highest grade, or 0.0 if no grades exist\n     */\n    public double getHighestGrade() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0.0;\n        }\n        \n        double highest = Double.MIN_VALUE;\n        for (double grade : grades.values()) {\n            if (grade > highest) {\n                highest = grade;\n            }\n        }\n        return highest;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the lowest grade among all subjects\n     * \n     * @return The lowest grade, or 0.0 if no grades exist\n     */\n    public double getLowestGrade() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0.0;\n        }\n        \n        double lowest = Double.MAX_VALUE;\n        for (double grade : grades.values()) {\n            if (grade < lowest) {\n                lowest = grade;\n            }\n        }\n        return lowest;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if a grade value is valid (between 0 and 100 inclusive)\n     * \n     * @param grade The grade to validate\n     * @return true if grade is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean isValidGrade(double grade) {\n        return grade >= 0.0 && grade <= 100.0;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if the report card has any grades\n     * \n     * @return true if there are grades, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasGrades() {\n        return !grades.isEmpty();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the number of subjects with grades\n     * \n     * @return Count of subjects\n     */\n    public int getSubjectCount() {\n        return grades.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clear all grades from the report card\n     */\n    public void clearAllGrades() {\n        grades.clear();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * String representation of the ReportCard\n     * Shows all subjects and grades, plus average\n     * \n     * @return Formatted string with report card details\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        if (grades.isEmpty()) {\n            return "Report Card: No grades available";\n        }\n        \n        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();\n        sb.append("Report Card:\\n");\n        for (Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : grades.entrySet()) {\n            sb.append(String.format("  %s: %.2f\\n", entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()));\n        }\n        sb.append(String.format("Average Grade: %.2f", calculateAverage()));\n        return sb.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if two report cards are equal\n     * Two report cards are equal if they have the same grades\n     * \n     * @param obj Object to compare with\n     * @return true if report cards have same grades, false otherwise\n     */\n    @Override\n    public boolean equals(Object obj) {\n        if (this == obj) return true;\n        if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) return false;\n        ReportCard that = (ReportCard) obj;\n        return Objects.equals(grades, that.grades);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Generate hash code based on grades map\n     * \n     * @return Hash code for the report card\n     */\n    @Override\n    public int hashCode() {\n        return Objects.hash(grades);\n    }\n}\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished. */\n    public Administrator(String username, String password) {\n        this.username = username;\n        this.password = password;\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        this.students = new false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if student already exists\n        for (Student s : students) {\n            if (s.getStudentId().equals(student.getStudentId())) {\n                return false; // Student ID already exists\n            }\n        }\n        \n        students.add(student);\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Find a student by their ID\n     * Student findStudentById(String studentId) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        for (Student student : students) {\n            if (student.getStudentId().equals(studentId)) {\n                return student;\n            }\n        }\n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Edit a student\'s report card by updating == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        ReportCard reportCard = student.getReportCard();\n        boolean allGradesValid = true;\n        \n        // Validate all grades before making any changes\n        for (java.util.Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : subjectGrades.entrySet()) {\n            if (!ReportCard.isValidGrade(entry.getValue())) {\n                allGradesValid = false;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!allGradesValid) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Update grades\n        for (java.util.Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : subjectGrades.entrySet()) {\n            reportCard.addOrUpdateGrade(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get all students in the system\n     * Only allowed if administrator is logged in\n     * \n     * @return List of all students, or empty list if not logged in\n     */\n    public List<Student> getAllStudents() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        return new ArrayList<>(students);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Remove a student from the system\n     * Only allowed if administrator is logged in\n     * \n     * @param studentId ID of the student to remove\n     * @return true if student removed successfully, false if null;\n        for (Student student : students) {\n            if (student.getStudentId().equals(studentId)) {\n                studentToRemove = student;\n                break;\n            }\n System displays form with fields to modify (including subject grades)\n * 2. User enters new data and clicks confirmation\n * 3. System displays confirmation message and shows the form with list of students\n */\npublic class EditOfOnePage {\n    private Administrator administrator;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for EditOfOnePage\n     * \n     * @param administrator The administrator who will perform the edit operation\n     */\n    public EditOfOnePage(Administrator administrator) {\n        this.administrator = administrator;\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the EditOfOnePage use case\n     * This method orchestrates the complete workflow for editing a student\'s report card\n     * \n     * @return true if the use case completed successfully, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeEditUseCase() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Starting EditOfOnePage Use Case ===");\n        \n        // Precondition check: Administrator must be logged in\n        if (!administrator.isLoggedIn()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Administrator must be logged in to perform this operation.");\n            System.out.println("Precondition failed: User is not logged in as administrator.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Precondition check: Administrator must have carried out \'DisplayedUnapagella\'\n        // and clicked the edit button (simulated by having students in the system)\n        if (administrator.getStudentCount() == 0) {\n            System.out.println("Error: No students available to edit.");\n            System.out.println("Precondition failed: Must have carried out \'DisplayedUnapagella\' first.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Display the form with list of students (simulating DisplayedUnapagella)\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Displaying List of Students ---");\n        displayStudentsList();\n        \n        // Step 2: Get student ID to }\n        \n        // Step 3: Display current report card for the selected student\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 3: Current Report Card ---");\n        Student student = administrator.findStudentById(studentId);\n        if (student == null) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Student not found with ID: " + studentId);\n            return false;\n        }\n        displayStudentReportCard(student);\n        \n        // Step 4: Display form with fields to modify\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Edit Form ---");\n        System.out.println("Enter new grades for the student (leave blank to keep current value).");\n        System.out.println("Enter \'done\' when finished entering grades.");\n        \n        // Step 5: Collect new grade data from user\n        Map<String, Double> newGrades = collectNewGrades(student.getReportCard());\n        \n        // Step 6: Confirm and apply changes\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 6: Confirmation ---");\n        if (confirmChanges(student, newGrades)) {\n            // Apply the changes\n            boolean success = administrator.editStudentReportCard(studentId, newGrades);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                // Step 7: Display confirmation message\n                System.out.println("\\n✓✓✓ CONFIRMATION MESSAGE ✓✓✓");\n                System.out.println("The report card for student " + student.getName() + \n                                 " (ID: " + studentId + ") has been successfully updated!");\n                \n                // Step 8: Display the form with list of students again\n                System.out.println("\\n--- Step 8: Updated List of Students ---");\n                displayStudentsList();\n                \n                // Postcondition: Report has been modified\n                System.out.println("\\n✓ Postcondition satisfied: Report for student has been modified.");\n                \n                // Simulate user interrupting connection to SMOS server\n                System.out.println("(Simulation: User interrupts connection to SMOS server)");\n                \n                return true;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Error: Failed to update report card. Please check if grades are valid (0-100).");\n                return false;\n            }\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Edit operation cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the list of all students in the system\n     * This simulates the \'DisplayedUnapagella\' functionality\n     */\n    private void displayStudentsList() {\n        System.out.println("List of Students:");\n        System.out.println("=================");\n        \n        java.util.List<Student> students = administrator.getAllStudents();\n        if (students.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No students found in the system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        for (int i = 0; i < students.size(); i++) {\n            Student student = students.get(i);\n            System.out.printf("%d. ID: %-10s Name: %-20s\\n", \n                            i + 1, student.getStudentId(), student.getName());\n        }\n        System.out.println("=================");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Prompt the user to enter a student ID for editing\n     * \n     * @return The student ID entered by user, or null if cancelled\n     */\n    private String promptForStudentId() {\n        System.out.print("Enter the Student ID to edit (or \'cancel\' to abort): ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("cancel")) {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled.");\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate student exists\n        Student student = administrator.findStudentById(input);\n        if (student == null) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Student with ID \'" + input + "\' not found.");\n            return promptForStudentId(); // Recursive retry\n        }\n        \n        return input;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the current report card for a student\n     * \n     * @param student The student whose report card to display\n     */\n    private void displayStudentReportCard(Student student) {\n        System.out.println("Student: " + student.getName() + " (ID: " + student.getStudentId() + ")");\n        System.out.println(student.getReportCard().toString());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Collect new grades from the user\n     * \n     * @param currentReportCard The current report card to show existing grades\n     * @return Map of subject names to new grade values\n     */\n    private Map<String, Double> collectNewGrades(ReportCard currentReportCard) {\n        Map<String, Double> newGrades = new HashMap<>();\n        Map<String, Double> currentGrades = currentReportCard.getAllGrades();\n        \n        if (currentGrades.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No existing grades found. You can add new subjects.");\n            System.out.println("Format: <subject_name> <grade> (grade must be 0-100)");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Current grades:");\n            for (Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : currentGrades.entrySet()) {\n                System.out.printf("  %s: %.2f\\n", entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());\n            }\n            System.out.println("Enter subject name and new grade, or just subject name to remove.");\n        }\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("\\nEnter subject and grade (or \'done\' to finish): ");\n            String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("done")) {\n                break;\n            }\n            \n            if (input.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("Please enter a subject name and grade.");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            // Parse input\n            String[] parts = input.split("\\\\s+", 2);\n            String subject = parts[0].trim();\n            \n            if (parts.length == 1) {\n                // User wants to remove this subject\n                System.out.println("Subject \'" + subject + "\' will be removed.");\n                newGrades.put(subject, null); // Using null to indicate removal\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            try {\n                double grade = Double.parseDouble(parts[1].trim());\n                \n                // Validate grade range\n                if (!ReportCard.isValidGrade(grade)) {\n                    System.out.println("Error: Grade must be between 0 and 100. Please try again.");\n                    continue;\n                }\n                \n                newGrades.put(subject, grade);\n                System.out.println("Added: " + subject + " = " + grade);\n                \n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid grade format. Please enter a number.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return newGrades;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the proposed changes and ask for confirmation\n     * \n     * @param student The student being edited\n     * @param newGrades The new grades to apply\n     * @return true if user confirms, false if user cancels\n     */\n    private boolean confirmChanges(Student student, Map<String, Double> newGrades) {\n        if (newGrades.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No changes to apply.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nProposed changes for student: " + student.getName());\n        System.out.println("==========================================");\n        \n        Map<String, Double> currentGrades = student.getReportCard().getAllGrades();\n        \n        for (Map.Entry<String, Double> entry : newGrades.entrySet()) {\n            String subject = entry.getKey();\n            Double newGrade = entry.getValue();\n            Double currentGrade = currentGrades.get(subject);\n            \n            if (newGrade == null) {\n                System.out.printf("  REMOVE: %s (current: %.2f)\\n", subject, \n                                currentGrade != null ? currentGrade : 0.0);\n            } else if (currentGrade == null) {\n                System.out.printf("  ADD: %s = %.2f (new)\\n", subject, newGrade);\n            } else {\n                System.out.printf("  UPDATE: %s: %.2f → %.2f\\n", \n                                subject, currentGrade, newGrade);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("==========================================");\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("Confirm changes? (yes/no): ");\n            String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            if (response.equals("yes") || response.equals("y")) {\n                return true;\n            } else if (response.equals("no") || response.equals("n")) {\n                return false;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Please enter \'yes\' or \'no\'.");\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Close the scanner resource\n     * Should be called when done with the EditOfOnePage instance\n     */\n    public void close() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the administrator associated with this EditOfOnePage instance\n     * \n     * @return The administrator object\n     */\n    public Administrator getAdministrator() {\n        return administrator;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * String representation of EditOfOnePage\n     * \n     * @return String describing the EditOfOnePage instance\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return "EditOfOnePage [Administrator: " + administrator.getUsername() + \n               ", Logged in: " + administrator.isLoggedIn() + "]";\n    }\n}\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished. /**
 * MainApplication class with the main method to run the complete program
 * and demonstrate the EditOfOnePage use case.
 * 
 * This program creates sample administrator and student data, handles login,
 * and executes the complete workflow as per the use case requirements.
 * It demonstrates the full functionality of editing a student's report card.
 */
public class MainApplication {
    
    /**
     * Main method - entry point of the application
     * 
     * @param args Command line arguments (not used in this application)
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("=== Student Report Card Management System ===\n");
        
        // Create an administrator with credentials
        Administrator admin = new Administrator("admin", "admin123");
        
        // Create sample students with report cards
        System.out.println("Initializing system with sample data...");
        initializeSampleData(admin);
        
        // Administrator login (simulating the preconditions)
        System.out.println("\n--- Administrator Login ---");
        boolean loginSuccess = admin.login("admin", "admin123");
        
        if (!loginSuccess) {
            System.out.println("Login failed. Exiting system.");
            return;
        }
        
        System.out.println("Login successful! Administrator is now logged in.");
        
        // Create EditOfOnePage instance to handle the use case
        EditOfOnePage editUseCase = new EditOfOnePage(admin);
        
        // Execute the EditOfOnePage use case
        System.out.println("\n=== Executing EditOfOnePage Use Case ===\n");
        
        boolean useCaseSuccess = editUseCase.executeEditUseCase();
        
        if (useCaseSuccess) {
            System.out.println("\n✓ EditOfOnePage use case completed successfully!");
        } else {
            System.out.println("\n✗ EditOfOnePage use case failed or was cancelled.");
        }
        
        // Display final state of the system
        System.out.println("\n=== Final System State ===");
        System.out.println(admin.toString());
        displayAllStudentsWithReportCards(admin);
        
        // Logout administrator (simulating connection interruption)
        admin.logout();
        System.out.println("\nAdministrator logged out. Connection to SMOS server interrupted.");
        
        // Close resources
        editUseCase.close();
        
        System.out.println("\n=== Program Execution Complete ===");
    }
    
    /**
     * Initialize the system with sample student data
     * This simulates the system having existing data that can be edited
     * 
     * @param admin The administrator to add students to
     */
    private static void initializeSampleData(Administrator admin) {
        // Create sample report cards
        ReportCard reportCard1 = new ReportCard();
        reportCard1.addOrUpdateGrade("Mathematics", 85.5);
        reportCard1.addOrUpdateGrade("Physics", 78.0);
        reportCard1.addOrUpdateGrade("Chemistry", 92.5);
        
        ReportCard reportCard2 = new ReportCard();
        reportCard2.addOrUpdateGrade("Mathematics", 90.0);
        reportCard2.addOrUpdateGrade("English", 88.5);
        reportCard2.addOrUpdateGrade("History", 76.0);
        reportCard2.addOrUpdateGrade("Computer Science", 95.0);
        
        ReportCard reportCard3 = new ReportCard();
        reportCard3.addOrUpdateGrade("Biology", 82.0);
        reportCard3.addOrUpdateGrade("Geography", 79.5);
        
        // Create sample students
        Student student1 = new Student("S001", "John Smith", reportCard1);
        Student student2 = new Student("S002", "Emma Johnson", reportCard2);
        Student student3 = new Student("S003", "Michael Brown", reportCard3);
        
        // Add students to administrator (simulating DisplayedUnapagella)
        admin.addStudent(student1);
        admin.addStudent(student2);
        admin.addStudent(student3);
        
        System.out.println("Created " + admin.getStudentCount() + " sample students.");
    }
    
    /**
     * Display all students with their report cards
     * 
     * @param admin The administrator containing the students
     */
    private static void displayAllStudentsWithReportCards(Administrator admin) {
        System.out.println("\nAll Students in System:");
        System.out.println("=======================");
        
        for (Student student : admin.getAllStudents()) {
            System.out.println("\n" + student.toString());
        }
        System.out.println("=======================");
    }
    
    /**
     * Helper method to demonstrate the complete workflow programmatically
     * This method shows how the system could be used without user input
     * for testing purposes
     */
    private static void demonstrateProgrammaticUseCase() {
        System.out.println("\n--- Programmatic Demonstration ---");
        
        // Create a fresh administrator
        Administrator demoAdmin = new Administrator("demo", "demo123");
        demoAdmin.login("demo", "demo123");
        
        // Create a sample student
        ReportCard demoReportCard = new ReportCard();
        demoReportCard.addOrUpdateGrade("Math", 75.0);
        demoReportCard.addOrUpdateGrade("Science", 82.0);
        
        Student demoStudent = new Student("D001", "Demo Student", demoReportCard);
        demoAdmin.addStudent(demoStudent);
        
        System.out.println("Before edit:");
        System.out.println(demoStudent.toString());
        
        // Edit the report card programmatically
        java.util.Map<String, Double> newGrades = new java.util.HashMap<>();
        newGrades.put("Math", 88.0);  // Update existing grade
        newGrades.put("English", 91.0); // Add new subject
        
        boolean editSuccess = demoAdmin.editStudentReportCard("D001", newGrades);
        
        if (editSuccess) {
            System.out.println("\nAfter edit:");
            System.out.println(demoAdmin.findStudentById("D001").toString());
            System.out.println("✓ Report card edited successfully!");
        } else {
            System.out.println("✗ Failed to edit report card.");
        }
        
        demoAdmin.logout();
    }
}

That is, the new content will start at the beginning of the specified line, and the existing content of that line will be moved down. This operation will NOT modify the content of the lines before or after the given line number. This function can not insert content the end of the file. Please use append_file instead, For example, if the file has the following content: ``` 001|contain g 002|contain h 003|contain i 004|contain j ``` and you call insert_content_at_line( file_name=\'file.txt\', line_number=2, insert_content=\'new line\' ) the file will be updated to: ``` 001|contain g 002|new line 003|contain h 004|contain i 005|contain j ``` ", "signature": "(self, file_name: str, line_number: int, insert_content: str) -> str", "parameters": "Args: file_name: (str): The name of the file to edit. line_number (int): The line number (starting from 1) to insert the content after. The insert content will be add between the line of line_number-1 and line_number insert_content (str): The content to insert betweed the previous_line_content and current_line_content.The insert_content must be a complete block of code at. NOTE: This tool is exclusive. If you use this tool, you cannot use any other commands in the current response. If you need to use it multiple times, wait for the next turn."}, "open_file": {"type": "function", "description": "Opens the file at the given path in the editor. an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are an autonomous programmer\n\nThe special interface consists of a file editor that shows you 100 lines of a file at a time.\n\nYou can use terminal commands (e.g., cat, ls, cd) by calling Terminal.run_command.\n\nYou should carefully observe the behavior and results of the previous action, and avoid triggering repeated errors.\n\nIn addition to the terminal, I also provide additional tools. \n\nIf provided an issue link, you first action must be navigate to the issue page using Browser tool to understand the issue.\n\nYour must check if the repository exists at the current path. If it exists, navigate to the repository path. If the repository doesn\'t exist, please download it and then navigate to it.\nAll subsequent actions must be performed within this repository path. Do not leave this directory to execute any actions at any time.\n\nNote:\n\n1. If you open a file and need to get to an area around a specific line that is not in the first 100 lines, say line 583, don\'t just use the scroll_down command multiple times. Instead, use the Editor.goto_line command. It\'s much quicker. \n2. Always make sure to look at the currently open file and the current working directory (which appears right after the currently open file). The currently open file might be in a different directory than the working directory! Note that some commands, such as \'create\', open files, so they might change the current open file.\n3. When using Editor.edit_file_by_replace, if there is no exact match, take the difference in indentation into consideration.\n4. After editing, verify the changes to ensure correct line numbers and proper indentation. Adhere to PEP8 standards for Python code.\n5. NOTE ABOUT THE EDIT COMMAND: Indentation really matters! When editing a file, make sure to insert appropriate indentation before each line! Ensuring the code adheres to PEP8 standards. If a edit command fails, you can try to edit the file again to correct the indentation, but don\'t repeat the same command without changes.\n6. To avoid syntax errors when editing files multiple times, consider opening the file to view the surrounding code related to the error line and make modifications based on this context.\n7. Ensure to observe the currently open file and the current working directory, which is displayed right after the open file. The open file might be in a different directory than the working directory. Remember, commands like \'create\' open files and might alter the current open file.\n8. Effectively using Use search commands (`search_dir`, `search_file`, `find_file`) and navigation commands (`open_file`, `goto_line`) to locate and modify files efficiently. The Editor tool can fully satisfy the requirements. Follow these steps and considerations for optimal results:\n\n9. When the edit fails, try to enlarge the range of code.\n10. You must use the Editor.open_file command to open a file before using the Editor tool\'s edit command to modify it. When you open a file, any currently open file will be automatically closed.\n11. Remember, when you use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the line numbers will change after the operation. Therefore, if there are multiple operations, perform only the first operation in the current response, and defer the subsequent operations to the next turn.\n11.1 Do not use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace more than once per command list.\n12. If you choose Editor.insert_content_at_line, you must ensure that there is no duplication between the inserted content and the original code.
